intro: Erythranthe variegata, commonly known as the variegated throatwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive variegated pattern of green and white. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
